question.text: Which of the following is correct about the given pedigree chart?

options.text: Inheritance of a condition like phenylketonuria as an autosomal recessive trait.
The pedigree chart is wrong as this is not possible.
Inheritance of a recessive sex-linked disease like haemophilia.
Inheritance of a sex-linked inborn error of metabolism like phenylketonuria.

solution.text: Pedigree analysis provides information regarding inheritance of particular traits or diseases and using it we can predict the possibility of appearance of any traits in the new generation. In the given chart, both son and daughter have the recessive trait suggesting it to an autosomal inheritance and not sex-linked. Since, it is not expressed in any of the parent but expressed in the children, the trait is recessive.
